updateData.description:
This method creates a record given the field values and record info 
from the data set info. It creates and ID and uses standard permissions.

This creates a list of create instructions to go along with a list of records to be created.

There is the option to assign the ID or to leave it as undefined, in which case
an automatically incremented ID will be assigned. (For consistency in the data
set, either all records should be preassigned or all records should be 
automatically assigned.
This creates a body for a commit request, given a list of instructions and a commit message.
This creates the requestOptions, suitable for apogee.net.jsonRequest, to go with an type of request to the workingset (micemetarequest) server.
This function creates an update instruction given an initial and target record. If the records are the same then NULL is returned. (No update is needed.)

updateData.functionBody: return getRecordErrString(record) + " - " + fieldInfo.name;
return record.Type + " " + record.Id;
return loginUrl;
return null;
return selectFilePostProcess.getFileEntry(fileEntryId);

updateData.description: This is the default file constructed from the inputs, according to a standard formula. An alternate file may be desired, in which case it can be constructed based on this file.
This is the type of out file to create.

updateData.functionBody: return fileEntryMap[fileEntryId];
return fileTypeLookupTable[fileTypeId];

var prefixLength = COMMUNITY_PREFIX.length;
return context.substr(prefixLength);

NOTES: {0} is for the file name, {1} is for the identifier, either cid or customer name

updateData.functionBody: return baseFileInfoMap[uploadType][fileType];
updateData.description:
- fileType - the meta data file type:
  "comFile"
  "propertyRules"
  "themeRules"
  "theme"
  "strings"
  "inputColors"

- uploadType - the scope of the meta file
  "community"
  "global"
  "customer"

- name - the meta file name

- identifier - cid for community or customer path name for customer

updateData.functionBody: return fileEntryLookupTable[recordId];
return recordType + "|" + section + "|" + entryName;

var key = getRecordNameLookupKey("propertyRules",section,entryName);
return propRulesFileEntryLookupTable[key];
return commonData.getSessionKey();

updateData.data:

updateData.functionBody: return commonData.getSessionKey();
